column2: Gluten-free bread, Avocado, Salt, Pepper, Red pepper flakes, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil
column3: 1. Toast gluten-free bread until golden brown.
column4: 2. Mash avocado and spread it evenly on the toast.
column5: 3. Sprinkle with salt pepper and red pepper flakes to taste.
column6: 4. Optionally top with sliced cherry tomatoes and a drizzle of olive oil.

column2: Chia seeds, Coconut milk, Stevia (or other keto-friendly sweetener), Vanilla extract, Mixed berries (such as strawberries blueberries raspberries)
column3: 1. In a bowl mix chia seeds coconut milk stevia and vanilla extract.
column4: 2. Stir well and let it sit in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight until thickened.

column2: Gluten-free oats, Almond milk, Stevia (or other keto-friendly sweetener), Berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Chia seeds
column3: 1. Cook gluten-free oats according to package instructions.
column4: 2. Once cooked sweeten with stevia and top with berries and chia seeds.

column2: Almond flour, Baking powder, Almond milk, Apple cider vinegar, Stevia (or other keto-friendly sweetener), Vanilla extract, Fresh fruit (such as berries, banana slices)
column3: 1. In a mixing bowl whisk together almond flour and baking powder.
column4: 2. In a separate bowl mix almond milk and apple cider vinegar and let it sit for a few minutes to curdle.
column5: 3. Add stevia and vanilla extract to the almond milk mixture.
column6: 4. Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed.
column7: 5. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and pour batter to form pancakes.
column8: 6. Cook until bubbles form on the surface then flip and cook until golden brown.

column2: Extra-firm tofu, Turmeric, Nutritional yeast, Garlic powder, Onion powder, Bell peppers, Spinach, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
column4: 2. Crumble tofu into the skillet and season with turmeric nutritional yeast garlic powder onion powder salt and pepper.
column5: 3. Cook for a few minutes then add chopped bell peppers spinach and cherry tomatoes.
column6: 4. Cook until vegetables are tender and tofu is heated through.

column3: Mixed greens, Avocado, Cherry tomatoes, Cucumber, Red onion, Lemon juice, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 1. In a large bowl combine mixed greens sliced avocado halved cherry tomatoes sliced cucumber and thinly sliced red onion.
column5: 2. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil.
column6: 3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

column3: Zucchini, Basil, Olive oil, Garlic, Nutritional yeast, Salt, Pepper
column4: 1. Use a spiralizer to turn zucchini into noodles.
column5: 2. In a food processor combine basil olive oil minced garlic nutritional yeast salt and pepper. Blend until smooth.
column6: 3. Toss zucchini noodles with pesto sauce until well coated.

column3: Coconut milk, Vegetable broth, Mixed vegetables (such as cauliflower, bell peppers, snap peas), Curry powder, Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 1. In a large pot heat olive oil over medium heat.
column5: 2. Add minced garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant.
column6: 3. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry for a few minutes.
column7: 4. Pour in coconut milk and vegetable broth.
column8: 5. Stir in curry powder and simmer until vegetables are tender.
column9: 6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

column3: Cauliflower, Mixed vegetables (such as broccoli, bell peppers, carrots, snap peas), Tofu, Gluten-free soy sauce, Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper

column8: 4. Add mixed vegetables and tofu and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
column9: 5. Stir in cauliflower rice and gluten-free soy sauce.
column10: 6. Cook for another minute until heated through.
column11: 7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

column3: Bell peppers, Cauliflower rice, Black beans, Corn, Onion, Garlic, Tomato sauce, Chili powder, Cumin, Paprika, Salt, Pepper

column6: 3. In a skillet sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened.
column7: 4. Add cooked cauliflower rice black beans corn tomato sauce chili powder cumin paprika salt and pepper to the skillet. Cook for a few minutes until heated through.
column8: 5. Stuff each bell pepper with the mixture.
column9: 6. Place stuffed bell peppers in a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes.

column2: Portobello Mushroom Burger with Lettuce Wraps
column3: Portobello mushrooms, Lettuce leaves, Tomato, Onion, Avocado, Mustard (check for lactose-free), Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 1. Remove stems from portobello mushrooms and brush with olive oil.
column5: 2. Grill or bake portobello mushrooms until tender.
column6: 3. Assemble burgers using lettuce leaves as buns and topping with sliced tomato onion and avocado.
column7: 4. Serve with lactose-free mustard on the side.

column3: Extra-firm tofu, Coconut milk, Red curry paste, Mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, snap peas, carrots), Cauliflower, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper

column5: 2. In a skillet heat olive oil over medium heat.
column6: 3. Add tofu cubes and cook until browned on all sides.
column7: 4. In a separate pot combine coconut milk and red curry paste. Bring to a simmer.
column8: 5. Add mixed vegetables to the coconut-curry sauce and cook until tender.

column12: 8. Serve coconut-curry tofu over cauliflower rice.

column3: Cauliflower, Almond flour, Flaxseed meal, Olive oil, Italian seasoning, Garlic powder, Tomato sauce, Vegan cheese, Toppings of choice (such as bell peppers, onions, mushrooms)

column6: 3. Combine cauliflower rice with almond flour flaxseed meal olive oil Italian seasoning and garlic powder. Mix until dough forms.
